verses.roman:
ete cāṁśa-kalāḥ puṁsaḥ
kṛṣṇas tu bhagavān svayam
indrāri-vyākulaṁ lokaṁ
mṛḍayanti yuge yuge

synonyms: ete—all these; ca—also; aṁśa-kalāḥ—part or part of the part; puṁsaḥ—of the Supreme Person; kṛṣṇaḥ tu—but Lord Kṛṣṇa; bhagavān—the original Personality of Godhead; svayam—Himself; indra-ari—the demons; vyākulam—disturbed; lokam—all the planets; mṛḍayanti—makes them happy; yuge yuge—in different millenniums.
translation: "All these incarnations of Godhead are either plenary portions or parts of the plenary portions of the puruṣa-avatāras. But Kṛṣṇa is the Supreme Personality of Godhead Himself. In every age He protects the world through His different features when the world is disturbed by the enemies of Indra."
